speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: SCENE II. Fife. Macduff's castle.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter LADY MACDUFF, her Son, and ROSS

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: What had he done, to make him fly the land?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: You must have patience, madam.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: He had none:

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: His flight was madness: when our actions do not,

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Our fears do make us traitors.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: You know not

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Whether it was his wisdom or his fear.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Wisdom! to leave his wife, to leave his babes,

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: His mansion and his titles in a place

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: From whence himself does fly? He loves us not;

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: He wants the natural touch: for the poor wren,

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: The most diminutive of birds, will fight,

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Her young ones in her nest, against the owl.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: All is the fear and nothing is the love;

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: As little is the wisdom, where the flight

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: So runs against all reason.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: My dearest coz,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: I pray you, school yourself: but for your husband,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: He is noble, wise, judicious, and best knows

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: The fits o' the season. I dare not speak

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: much further;

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: But cruel are the times, when we are traitors

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: And do not know ourselves, when we hold rumour

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: From what we fear, yet know not what we fear,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: But float upon a wild and violent sea

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Each way and move. I take my leave of you:

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Shall not be long but I'll be here again:

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Things at the worst will cease, or else climb upward

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: To what they were before. My pretty cousin,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Blessing upon you!

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Father'd he is, and yet he's fatherless.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: I am so much a fool, should I stay longer,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: It would be my disgrace and your discomfort:

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: I take my leave at once.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Sirrah, your father's dead;

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: And what will you do now? How will you live?

speaker: Son
text_entry: As birds do, mother.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: What, with worms and flies?

speaker: Son
text_entry: With what I get, I mean; and so do they.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Poor bird! thou'ldst never fear the net nor lime,

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: The pitfall nor the gin.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Why should I, mother? Poor birds they are not set for.

speaker: Son
text_entry: My father is not dead, for all your saying.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Yes, he is dead; how wilt thou do for a father?

speaker: Son
text_entry: Nay, how will you do for a husband?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Why, I can buy me twenty at any market.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Then you'll buy 'em to sell again.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Thou speak'st with all thy wit: and yet, i' faith,

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: With wit enough for thee.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Was my father a traitor, mother?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Ay, that he was.

speaker: Son
text_entry: What is a traitor?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Why, one that swears and lies.

speaker: Son
text_entry: And be all traitors that do so?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Every one that does so is a traitor, and must be hanged.

speaker: Son
text_entry: And must they all be hanged that swear and lie?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Every one.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Who must hang them?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Why,  the honest men.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Then the liars and swearers are fools,

speaker: Son
text_entry: for there are liars and swearers enow to beat

speaker: Son
text_entry: the honest men and hang up them.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Now, God help thee, poor monkey!

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: But how wilt thou do for a father?

speaker: Son
text_entry: If he were dead, you'ld weep for

speaker: Son
text_entry: him: if you would not, it were a good sign

speaker: Son
text_entry: that I should quickly have a new father.

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Poor prattler, how thou talk'st!

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Bless you, fair dame! I am not to you known,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Though in your state of honour I am perfect.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I doubt some danger does approach you nearly:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: If you will take a homely man's advice,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Be not found here; hence, with your little ones.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: To fright you thus, methinks, I am too savage;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: To do worse to you were fell cruelty,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Which is too nigh your person. Heaven preserve you!

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I dare abide no longer.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Whither should I fly?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: I have done no harm. But I remember now

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: I am in this earthly world; where to do harm

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Is often laudable, to do good sometime

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Accounted dangerous folly: why then, alas,

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Do I put up that womanly defence,

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: To say I have done no harm?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Enter Murderers

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: What are these faces?

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Where is your husband?

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: I hope, in no place so unsanctified

speaker: LADY MACDUFF
text_entry: Where such as thou mayst find him.

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: He's a traitor.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Thou liest, thou shag-hair'd villain!

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: What, you egg!

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Stabbing him

speaker: First Murderer
text_entry: Young fry of treachery!

speaker: Son
text_entry: He has kill'd me, mother:

speaker: Son
text_entry: Run away, I pray you!

speaker: Son
text_entry: Dies

speaker: Son
text_entry: Exit LADY MACDUFF, crying 'Murder!' Exeunt Murderers, following her
